definition: to wrestle/to grapple/to scuffle
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)

sentences.english: Then they came fighting out of the door of The Index.
sentences.chinese: 只看到他们从印岱克斯的门里扭打出来。
大吵大闹之后他们又扭打在一起。

sentences.english: He tells José that he has come to find Carmen, and the two men fight.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉贺塞，他是为了找卡门而来，两人扭打在一起。

sentences.english: They struggled with each other for a girl.
sentences.chinese: 他们为争夺一个女孩扭打成一团。

sentences.english: The two boxers struggled with each other and the referee separated them.
sentences.chinese: 两位拳击手扭打在一起，裁判把他们分开了。

sentences.english: At this time, return XieYi reaches found that they, with a scuffle.
sentences.chinese: 此时，归来的谢易达发现两人，与安在勇一阵扭打。

sentences.english: Two others were slashed as they wrestled the shooter to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 另外两人在与枪手扭打在地的过程中受了些轻伤。

sentences.english: In fact, it turned on Mbulu, grappled with him, and sent his hurtling to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 相反地，它转向恩布鲁，一阵扭打后，把他扔到地上。

sentences.english: When she scuffled with the police, she tore the sleeves of one policeman's jacket.
sentences.chinese: 在同警察的扭打中，她撕破了一个警察上衣的袖子。

sentences.english: The guards wrestled with the intrude rs.
sentences.chinese: 护卫员同闯入的人扭打起来。

sentences.english: The drivers were robbed of a set of fundamental eat it, and they are struggling with.
sentences.chinese: 那名被抢的司机根本不吃这一套，和他们扭打起来。

sentences.english: In the hallway outside, a scuffle of feet. A clink of metal.
sentences.chinese: 在走廊外面，有扭打的痕迹和金属发出的声音。

sentences.english: Chi Ming very angry, the result two people fighting in the street.
sentences.chinese: 志明非常气愤，结果二人在街上扭打起来。

sentences.english: The two men quarrelled and there was a scuffle.
sentences.chinese: 这两个人先是争吵起来，接着又扭打在一起。

definition: to fight together/to come to blows
to chase and beat
to shove/to jostle
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to try to stop a fight/to intervene in a fight
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
physical encounter/fight
to push and shove
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
to gang up and beat
